annotations.text: CLEVELAND — Police invstigating domestic disputes had previously gone to the home where a man fatally shot two police officers over the weekend, but no arrests were ever made, police reports from the Columbus suburb of Westerville show.

annotations.reason: The language used in the text is neutral and factual.
annotations.text: Westerville Officers Eric Joering, 39, and Anthony Morelli, 54, were killed shortly after noon Saturday in this normally quiet suburb while responding to a 911 hang-up call.

annotations.reason: The statement aims to describe the sequence of events in a structured manner.
annotations.text: The suspect, 30-year-old Quentin Smith, was shot and wounded by the officers and taken to Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center in critical condition Saturday.
